intro: Sisymbrium lagascae, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and has small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain the seeds. Sisymbrium lagascae is often found in open habitats such as fields and along roadsides.
